page.title: 19TRADE, RELIGION
page.content: {TRADE }There are three shops selling groceries, vegetables and sweets. One is also a Post Office, one sells and delivers papers. Milk is delivered to the door daily. Three Public houses, one with Bar-food. Self employed carpenter, builders and one cutting up trees for use. {RELIGION}There are churches in North and South Leverton and in Sturton-le- Steeple, 2 miles north: one Methodist Chapel in North Leverton. Rev. Akerman in Leverton, Rev.Butt in Sturton. The Methodist chapel is in the Retford Circuit. All have Sunday Schools, for children of about 3 to 14 years. Churches do not have the influence they once had but do have a place in society. There are pipe organs in South Leverton and Sturton Churches and a Hammond organ in North Leverton.
